name: GoogleCloudFunctions
description: Deploy code to GCP Functions or create, remove and call functions
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://github.com/nexsolab/azure-devops-google-cloud-tools#readme) or [see the Functions documentation](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/functions)
author: Gabriel Anderson

inputs.name: authenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication method
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Authorization requires the following Google IAM permission on the specified resources:
`cloudfunctions.functions.call`
`cloudfunctions.functions.create`
`cloudfunctions.functions.delete`
`cloudfunctions.functions.get`
`cloudfunctions.functions.sourceCodeSet`

inputs.name: serviceAccount
inputs.label: Google Cloud Service Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Service Account that should be used for the next steps

inputs.name: jsonCredentials
inputs.label: JSON Credentials file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the JSON file with the credentials, see for more information

inputs.name: gcpProject
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or select the Project where this function should be created.

inputs.name: gcpRegion
inputs.label: Region
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or select the region where this function should be created.

inputs.name: funcName
inputs.label: Function name
inputs.helpMarkDown: A user-defined name of the function. Function names must be unique globally.

inputs.name: funcCallData
inputs.label: Input to be passed to the function.
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Data could be a string or a JSON (started by `[` or `{` chars).
**Note about execution:**
Synchronously invokes a deployed Cloud Function. To be used for testing purposes as very limited traffic is allowed. For more information on the actual limits, refer to [Rate Limits](https://cloud.google.com/functions/quotas#rate_limits).

inputs.name: funcHttpsAnonym
inputs.label: Allow unauthenticated
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If set, makes this a public function. This will allow all callers, without checking authentication.
Check this if your service is an API or public site.

inputs.name: funcBucket
inputs.label: Google Cloud Storage bucket name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Every change in files in this bucket will trigger function execution.

inputs.name: funcTopic
inputs.label: Name of Pub/Sub topic
inputs.helpMarkDown: Every message published in this topic will trigger function execution with message contents passed as input data.

inputs.name: funcEvent
inputs.label: Event
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or select the region where this function should be created.

inputs.name: funcEventResource
inputs.label: Resource observed
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies which resource from event is being observed.

inputs.name: funcDesc
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: User-provided description of a function.

inputs.name: funcSourceZip
inputs.label: Source ZIP file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ZIP file with source code for function. (max: 100MB)

inputs.name: funcSourceRepo
inputs.label: Source repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source repository where a function is hosted. (beta)

inputs.name: funcSourceArchive
inputs.label: Source Archive URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Google Cloud Storage URL, starting with gs://, pointing to the zip archive which contains the function.

inputs.name: funcEntryPoint
inputs.label: Entry point
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the function (as defined in source code) that will be executed. Defaults to the resource name suffix, if not specified.

inputs.name: funcServiceAccount
inputs.label: Service Account E-mail
inputs.helpMarkDown: The email of the function's service account. If empty, defaults to `{project_id}@appspot.gserviceaccount.com`.

inputs.name: funcRuntime
inputs.label: Runtime
inputs.helpMarkDown: The runtime in which to run the function.

inputs.name: funcTimeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The function execution timeout. Execution is considered failed and can be terminated if the function is not completed at the end of the timeout period. Defaults to 60 seconds. A duration in seconds with up to nine fractional digits, terminated by 's'. Example: "3.5s".

inputs.name: funcMemory
inputs.label: Memory (in MB)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The amount of memory in MB available for a function. Defaults to 256MB.

inputs.name: funcMaxInstances
inputs.label: Maximum instances
inputs.helpMarkDown: The limit on the maximum number of function instances that may coexist at a given time.

inputs.name: funcEnvVars
inputs.label: Function Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Environment variables that shall be available during function execution.

inputs.name: funcNetwork
inputs.label: Network
inputs.helpMarkDown: The VPC Network that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network resource. If the short network name is used, the network must belong to the same project. Otherwise, it must belong to a project within the same organization. The format of this field is either `projects/{project}/global/networks/{network}` or `{network}`, where `{project}` is a project id where the network is defined, and `{network}` is the short name of the network. [VPC Documentation](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/vpc)

inputs.name: funcVpcConnector
inputs.label: VPC Connector
inputs.helpMarkDown: The VPC Network Connector that this cloud function can connect to. It can be either the fully-qualified URI, or the short name of the network connector resource. The format of this field is projects/*/locations/*/connectors/*. [VPC Documentation](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/vpc)

inputs.name: funcVpcConnectorEgress
inputs.label: VPC Connector - Egress Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: The egress settings for the connector, controlling what traffic is diverted through it.

options.PRIVATE_RANGES_ONLY: Use the VPC Access Connector only for private IP space from RFC1918.
options.ALL_TRAFFIC: Force the use of VPC Access Connector for all egress traffic from the function.

inputs.name: funcVpcConnectorIngress
inputs.label: VPC Connector - Ingress Settings
inputs.helpMarkDown: The egress settings for the connector, controlling what traffic is diverted through it.

options.ALLOW_ALL: Allow HTTP traffic from public and private sources.
options.ALLOW_INTERNAL_ONLY: Allow HTTP traffic from only private VPC sources.

inputs.name: deploySourceZip
inputs.label: Source ZIP file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ZIP file with source code for function. (max: 100MB)

inputs.name: deploySourceRepo
inputs.label: Source repository
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source repository where a function is hosted. (beta)

inputs.name: deploySourceArchive
inputs.label: Source Archive URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Google Cloud Storage URL, starting with gs://, pointing to the zip archive which contains the function.

inputs.name: gcpLabels
inputs.label: Resource labels
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Put JSON or use the editor.
**Keys** must start with a lowercase character and contain only hyphens (\-), underscores (\_), lowercase characters, and numbers.
**Values** must contain only hyphens (\-), underscores (\_), lowercase characters, and numbers.

inputs.name: gcpBillingProject
inputs.label: Billing Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Google Cloud Platform project that will be charged quota for operations performed in gcloud. If you need to operate on one project, but need quota against a different project, you can use this flag to specify the billing project.

OutputVariables.name: FunctionVersionId
OutputVariables.description: The version identifier of the Cloud Function. Each deployment attempt results in a new version of a function being created.

OutputVariables.name: FunctionCallResult
OutputVariables.description: Result of function invocation. (if the operation = Call)
